Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (mostly worn); trace of motif in added white; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander between pairs of lines at rim; below, pendant corner roundel and elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The exterior decoration is typical of the Wild Goat Style, but not of the later Mature Animal Style, where Lemos places the sherd, although the presence of added white on the interior surface suggests that the sherd is late in the Wild Goat Style and marks a transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 592, pl. 74)
Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 206-7, N14) (with wrong orientation)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0406) (phase 2)
